{
  "Allegations" : "IN JANUARY 2002, A COMPLAINT WAS FILED AGAINST AN INVESTMENT ADVISOR ASSOCIATED WITH MR. HENLEY IN HIS PREVIOUS ASSOCIATION WITH HORIZON CAPITAL MANAGEMENT, INC., AS WELL AS AGAINST PAUL HENLEY INDIVIDUALLY, SEEKING TO RECOUP LOSSES OF APPROXIMATELY $500,000 INCURRED BY THE PLAINTIFF, A PRIVATE PARTNERSHIP IN WHICH HORIZON CAPITAL MANAGEMENT, INC. WAS THE GENERAL PARTNER.  [CUSTOMER], A CALIFORNIA RESIDENT, HIRED NORMAN YU, A CALIFORNIA MONEY MANAGER, AS HIS INVESTMENT ADVISOR.  NORMAN YU WAS ALSO THE MONEY MANAGER IN THE PARTNERSHIP IN QUESTION.  [CUSTOMER] FILED A COMPLAINT AGAINST NORMAN YU, HIS COMPANY, THE AUDIT FIRM, THE ACCOUNTANT, AND THE ABOVE MENTIONED GROUP (HORIZON, HENLEY). IN ITS CAPACITY AS GENERAL PARTNER, HORIZON NOTIFIED THE LIMITED PARTNERS IN WRITING THAT THEY WERE UNCOMFORTABLE WITH THE DIRECTION MR. YU WAS GOING IN HIS CAPACITY AS AN INVESTMENT ADVISOR TO THE PARTNERSHIP AND THAT HORIZON WAS WITHDRAWING HORIZON FUNDS FROM MR. YU.  HORIZON FURTHER RECOMMENDED THAT OTHER CLIENTS, INCLUDING [CUSTOMER], DO THE SAME (WITHDRAW FUNDS). [CUSTOMER]'S RELATIONSHIP WITH MR. YU WAS SUCH THAT MR. YU WAS ABLE TO PERSUADE [CUSTOMER] TO REMAIN IN THE PARTNERSHIP, AS WELL AS CONTINUE TO RETAIN MR. YU AS ADVISOR FOR MONEY INVESTED OUTSIDE OF THE FUND.  MR. HENLEY BELIEVES THE HORIZON ACTED RESPONSIBLY AND THAT THE CLAIM IS BASELESS. MR.
